alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:30AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Strong south winds to gale force will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday, persisting into Friday before they diminish. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated storm surge values of 2-6 feet above the normal high tide line. The highest water levels will likely impact northern Norton Sound from Nome to Shaktoolik. Water is expected to push into low lying areas along the coast. Waves will also be washing up near the top of the beach for the remainder of the area. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away. For the latest weather forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta
